snippet: Nancy Lanza loved guns, and it was one from her collection that was apparently used to take her life Friday, when her son went on a shooting rampage.
abstract: Friends of Nancy Lanza say she was gun enthusiast, and it appears her son Adam used guns from her collection in carrying out his shooting rampage in Newtown, Conn; Lanza was her son's first victim before he drove to Sandy Hook Elementary School, where he killed 26 more people, 20 of them small children, then killed himself; investigators are still trying to determine what caused him to carry out one of worst massacres in the nation's history.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer reported from Newtown, Conn., and Ravi Somaiya from New York. Reporting was also contributed by Susan Beachy, Thomas Kaplan, Elizabeth Maker, Marina Villeneuve and Steven Yaccino.

lead_paragraph: Nancy Lanza loved guns, and it was one from her collection that was apparently used to take her life Friday, when her son went on a shooting rampage.

headline.seo: Adam Lanza’s Mother Was a Gun Enthusiast, Friends Say
headline.main: A Mother, a Gun Enthusiast and the First Victim
